payroll_cost_details: Maximum annual employer contribution per employee

notes: Percentage based on percentage of weekly insurable earning. Maximum yearly insurable earnings is $49,500.
Percentage based on percentage of weekly insurable earning. Maximum yearly insurable earnings is $49,500.

payroll_cost_details: Avg cost for all manufacturing per $100 payroll
notes: There is no separate rating for manufacturing occupations in British Columbia. Ratings by industry apply to all workers in that industry, regardless of occupation. Average rate for all Manufacuring sectors is provided. Rates apply to maximum gross earnings of C$78,600 per year per employee. (2015)

There is no separate rating for office occupations in British Columbia. Ratings by industry apply to all workers in that industry, regardless of occupation. Rates for Business Services range from $0.10 to $1.05 per $100 of payroll (average $0.34). Rates apply to maximum gross earnings of C$78,600 per year per employee. (2015)
Maximum per employee set at 90% of net annual earnings (after deductions for income taxes, Canada Pension Plan & Employment Insurance), up  up to a maximum wage of C$78,600 per year.
